User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Ubuntu; Linux x86_64; rv:59.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/59.0
Build ID: 20180404120016

Steps to reproduce:

I downloaded the installer from https://ftp.mozilla.org/pub/firefox/releases/60.0esr/win64/fr/ and checked the integrity.

Then I wanted to test installer options that I found here : https://firefox-source-docs.mozilla.org/browser/installer/windows/installer/FullConfig.html

Therefore I ran (in a powershell terminal as administrator) :

& ".\Firefox Setup 60.0esr.exe" /DesktopShortcut=false /StartMenuShortcut=false /TaskbarShortcut=true


Actual results:

The installer seems to discard the command-line options : I get a desktop shortcut and a start menu shortcut but no taskbar shortcut.


Expected results:

With /DesktopShortcut=false /StartMenuShortcut=false /TaskbarShortcut=true, the installer should create a taskbar shortcut but no desktop shortcut and no start menu shortcut.

The standard installation with the GUI creates all three shortcuts.

Test environment : Windows 7 Pro 64bit in VirtualBox
